channel.title: Unlocking KBot (v397)
channel.description:
Because nobody wants to be forced to donate, right?
Have a look at [url=http://www.megaupload.com/?d=RXKG4RD5]KBotDonatorHack.jar[/url], source included for those who are interested.

item.title: Unlocking KBot (v397)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:14, topic:342853”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=439259.msg3233754#msg3233754 date=1276306668]

considering i and an acquaintance named jacmob did this the day following the initial alpha release… you’ve done nothing new.

Super cool bro!
[/quote]

last i checked this is a programming board, not an act-like-a-fucktard one.[/quote]

Then quit acting like a fucktard by saying shit like “I did this the day it came out, before you did, and better.”, if you didn’t post code, you didn’t do it. I can say I wrote a kernel better than Linux in 1991 before Linux came out, but no one would believe me.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Unlocking KBot (v397)
item.dc:creator: @DarKcookie DarKcookie
item.description:
@DarKcookie wrote:

That’s nowhere near nasty code in my book.

I assume you wrote the deob utility for it yourself?
Mine isn’t able to handle Allatori’s obfuscation yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Unlocking KBot (v397)
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

private static String decode(String cipher_txt, Context ctx) { String key = ctx.subjectOwner().name.replace("/", ".") + ctx.subject().name; int orig_key_idx = key.length() - 1; int xor_key = 85; int key_idx = orig_key_idx; int length = cipher_txt.length(); char[] decoded = new char[length]; for (int i = length - 1; i >= 0; i--) { if (key_idx < 0) { key_idx = orig_key_idx; } char key_val = key.charAt(key_idx--); decoded[i] = (char) (key_val ^ (cipher_txt.charAt(i) ^ xor_key)); xor_key = (char) (63 & (xor_key ^ (i ^ key_val))); } return new String(decoded); }

Read full topic

item.title: Unlocking KBot (v397)
item.dc:creator: @DarKcookie DarKcookie
item.description:
@DarKcookie wrote:

oksuper_:

i had some pretty nasty code to remove Allatori’s string encryption

http://pastebin.com/mB4NzSht

I’d say mine definitely meets the requirements to join the nasty club.
Didn’t know it was Allatori tho, thanks for pointing that out.
Mind telling me how you figured that out?
I just worked with what I saw in the JAD output.

EDIT: Note that it does not produce working source code, it only decrypts the string litterals,
leaving the internal decryption call intact.

Read full topic

item.title: Unlocking KBot (v397)
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

i had some pretty nasty code to remove Allatori’s string encryption

Read full topic

item.title: Unlocking KBot (v397)
item.dc:creator: @DarKcookie DarKcookie
item.description:
@DarKcookie wrote:

oksuper_:

considering i and an acquaintance named jacmob did this the day following the initial alpha release… you’ve done nothing new. haven’t checked, but is it even deobfuscated?

Why would you want to bother deobfuscating the entire bot,
when all it takes to unlock his donator features is ‘hacking’ his naïve login system?
All I needed was to reverse the string encryption, but that’s not included iirc.

As mentioned above, KBot is now dead/dying.
Moments after I posted, their forum updated to display the announcement.

Read full topic
